'''Kheledûl''' is a Dwarven port at the [[Lhûn]] held by the [[Dourhands]] in the game ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]''.

==History==
Kheledûl was originally founded by [[Thorin]] when he built [[Thorin's Hall]], as a port to trade with Zigilgund upstream in [[Forochel]], or maybe with the Elves of [[Duillond]], [[Celondim]] and [[Mithlond]], and far away in the south to the [[White Mountains]].<ref>{{LOTROW|Scouting the Dourhands|2025-08-13}}</ref> When he found the city, he built a spire: the founding Spire of Kheledûl.<ref>{{LOTROW|Spire of Kheledûl|2025-08-13}}</ref> 

But at the time of the War of the Ring, the docks are overtaken by [[Skorgrím]]'s [[Dourhands]] and it is now an evil place to come. They use it as a base to further the operations of [[Angmar]].

==Etymology==
''Kheledûl'' is comprised of the [[Khuzdul]] word ''kheled'', which means "glass", such as in ''Kheled-zâram'', [[Mirrormere]],<ref>{{RS|4XXVN}}, Note 39</ref> and ''ûl'', which has no particular meaning.
